text: Sweet caramel, dry fruit and rum. Pleasantly complex, balanced with time. 2 year old bottle.

Gedronken tijdens Borefts 2016, uitgeschonken vanuit een fles. Diepe donkerbruine kleur, licht troebel met roodachtige gloed, een kleine kakikleurige schuimkraag. De aromas zijn zeer vineus en complex van karakter, echt een Barley Wine. Eikenhout, rode wijn, vanille, chocolade, kokos, donkerfruit als vijgen en dadels. Het smaakpallet volgt de aromas vol en rijk, fruitig vineus en licht zoet, complex met vele smaaklagen. Eerst karamel, chocolade en donker fruit, daarna rode wijn en vanille, met een zachte verwarmende afdronk van eikenhout. Zachte carbonatie, met een verfijnd en vol olieachtig mondgevoel. Zeker een van de beste bieren van Borefts 2016, sowieso de beste Barley Wine. Graag nog eens een fles zien te bemachtigen, om dit complexe bier verder te doorgronden, echt een aanrader voor de liefhebber van sterke en complexe bieren.

Data ważności:  29.12.2026 
 Kolor:  Ciemnobrunatny, wpadający już w czarny. 
 Piana:  Jak na takie parametry, 
to piana i tak jest niezła. Ma ona jasnobeżowy kolor i drobną strukturę.
Dość szybko redukuje się do całkiem sporej wstążeczki.
Ta obrączka cały czas wisi nad piwem.
Pięknie tez krążuje na szkle. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jaki wydobywa się z butelki to jest po prostu poezja. Pierwsze nuty zapachowe to owoce: ciemne i te czerwone. Dojrzałe winogrona, czereśnie, wiśnie, śliwki.
Zaraz za nimi ogrom wanilii, karmelu, toffi, słodkiej czekolady, melasy i wiórek kokosowych.
Ogromna porcja beczkowych elementów. Czuć zarówno mokrą dębinę, jak i owocowe klimaty. Z pewnością można stawiać na beczkę po bourbonie, whisky, czy Cognacu. Piwo jest potężnie złożone, wielowymiarowe w zapachu.
Z każdą minutą dochodzi do tego coś nowego. 
Aromat po prostu miażdży! 
 Smak:  W smaku intensywnie owocowe. Co tu się nie wyprawia! Śliwki, jabłka, ciemne winogrona, gruszki, czereśnie. Jest bardzo dużo słodkich posmaków: karmel, czekolada, toffi, creme brulee.
Wyraźnie czuć wpływy wielu beczek. Raz po raz pokazują się nuty szlachetnych alkoholi takich jak: rum, Cognac, whisky, bourbon czy czerwone wino.
Dębowe klimaty przeplatają się z owocowymi estrami.
Alkohol jest fajnie rozgrzewający, już na pograniczu wychodzącego na wierzch, ale jeszcze na akceptowalnym poziomie.
Tekstura nie jest jeszcze ulepkowata, ale jest gęsta.
Doskonały "sipper". Można się z nim cały wieczór bawić. 
Doskonała robota. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Ten Barley Wine jest blendem różnych warek tego piwa, które były leżakowane w różnych rodzajach beczek po różnych alkoholach.

Gigantyczny Barley Wine. Wielowarstwowy, kompleksowy,,ułożony w aromacie i smaku.
Ogrom składowych może zaskoczyć wielu smakoszy i wielbicieli tego stylu.
Piwo jest intensywnie owocowe, słodkie z wieloma elementami najlepszych deserów świata.
Leżakowanie w wielorakich beczkach nadało trunkowi cech charakterystycznych dla poszczególnych szlachetnych alkoholi.
BW na najwyższym światowym poziomie.
Tap at TCBW2017, Tallinn. Colour is clear brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Dryness, dry fruits and malts. Very dry.
0,1l on tap @ TCBW 2017. Pours very dark brown with a low head. Aroma is sweet malts and alcohol. Flavor is sweet malts, dark fruits, alcohol and hops. Great.
Tap at TCBW. Opaque black color, steady beige head. Toasted malty nose has vanilla, oak and alcohol. Full-bodied. Sweetish vanilla, loads of alcohol. Burning aftertaste.

Bottle 0,33L. Its hard to open it. Foggy, very dark brown color with small, frothy, light brown head, that falls down soon. Aroma is great: bourbon, dark fruits, coconuts, vanilla, berries. It blows you away! Taste is light to medium bitter with fruits at the start and wood tartness at the end of the sip. A touch of alcohol warms up in the aftertaste, but alcohol is not obvious, having in mind, it has 12,3% abv. Simply - excellent!

Appearance: Very dark brown, almost no head.
Aroma: Malt, dark fruits, vinous.
Taste: Malt, vinous, dark fruits. Coffee/Chocolate notes. Slight alcohol.
Bought: Craft Gallery, 330 ml, CHF 19.80
Info: 25/2-2017, BB: 19/6-2025

1. 3. 2017, Ljubljana. Bottled. Aroma like wine, very potent and strong from the first sip. Fullbodied fruity, woody, spirity taste with tasteable alcohol and a plethora of tones and undertones. Maybe to much diversity for my taste, but interesting nevertheless.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blend 0615: Aroma is dense and intensive, plums, raisings, dark fruits, cacao, soy sauce, some alcohol. Dark brown color, no head. Flavor is full of cacao powder with plums, cgherries, dark chocolate. Very nice, tasty blend.
1.5 year old bottle, coconut bourbon rum, dry fruit esters, darker caramel specter + light roast, wood well developed, alco warmth, med sweetness, smooth enough

24th September 2016Borefts VIII. Day 2. Keg. Hazy red - amber beer, tidy cream colour head. Palate is smooth and semi dry, modest fine carbonation. Smooth malts, lightly sweet. Ripe fruits. A little cherry and blackcurrant. Light finish. Rich and tasty.

Blend 1116. Bottle. Sensoric. Pitch black with small, light brown, semi thick head. Poor head retention and lacing (like in most BW). Moderate to heavy malty aroma - toasted, sugary, candy, slightly caramel, but not overloaded. Definitely bourbon accents, Id say quite strong bourbon and barrel. This is nice, along with dried fruits very nice. Slightly boozy. Medium to full body, slick texture, soft carbonation, finish is sweet, malty, oaky and dark fruits. Slightly ABV warming. In overall this one is a little Angels Share BA Bourbon from Lost Abbey ;) Go for it.

Sample at Borefts 2016. Poured a clear dark brown with a round tan head. The aroma is sweet sugary malt, alcohol. The flavour is moderate sweet with a big smooth oily alcoholic palate. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Blend 0615


Aroma:

Heavy aroma of malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate, molasses and roasted malts.

Appearance:

Opaque dark brown beer with slight yeast and with no/a slight beige head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts heavy sweet with malts, caramel, wood, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruit, chocolate and molasses; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. I have no idea on what barrels they aged it, but it sure as hell works out perfectly. Shamefully the head disappears quite quickly.

UPDATED: FEB 12, 2017 Revised rate for blend 0615 & 1116: Pours dark reddish brown, clear, with unstable foamy beige head, which transsforms itself to a ring a round the glass. Aroma: gentle sherry-like (bourbon, cognac) aroma supported with notes of malts which takes on toasted toffee, chocolate...flavor is similar to aroma, with gentle sherry-like (whisky/cognac) notes, supported and pretty well balanced with malt flavors, which takes on toasted toffee, chocolate, hint of caramel, supported with dark fruits esters, with vinous notes,  notes of oak (woody), some phenols of vanilla (or vanillin), some polyphenols ..finish is dry, slightly astringent with drying mouthfeel which lingers in aftertaste (as by red wine). Alcohol warmth is noticeable. Body is thick, texture soft, carbo low to medium.
Blend 0615 after 3 bottles: 8-4-8-4-17= 4.2
Blend 1116 after 2 bottles: 7-4-8-4-16= 4.0

Bottle pour at Bevog Who Cares Fest, 2016. Pours dark brown with small beige head. Caramel, malty, dried fruit, vanilla, dark fruit, wooden notes, some cocoa. Light alcohol, warming, sweet, bit sticky. Complex. Full bodied.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4, many thanks! Pours dark brown with a little head. Aroma is strong booze and malts, almond. Heavy, sweet, boozy, sticky. Long warming palate. Very nice.

24/IX/16 - on tap @ Borefts Bier Festival - BB: n/a (2016-1171) Thanks to the Belgian ratebeer crew for sharing todays beers!
Clear dark brown beer, no head. Aroma: sweet, malty, dried fruits, raisins, caramel, quite some vanilla, bourbon? MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: sweet start, malty, grains, vanilla, bit sugary, sourish touch, alcohol. Aftertaste: bitter touch, caramel, sweet, pretty oxidised, but sugary, more vanilla, sweet malts, very nice!
Tasted at Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Caramel, oak, candy sugar, fruits, vanilla. Smooth.
Bue à la pression au Borefts Beer Festival 2016. Javais dautres choses à faire que de prendre des notes ;)

33cl Bottle shared. Apperance: A bit unclear dark brown,with a small off-white head. Aroma: malts, vanilla and wood, with quite some bourbon tones.
Taste Sweet,malts caramel, vanilla, and again a lot of bourbon, a bit alcohol and dark fruit. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. 
But from the description we expected a bit more complexity as lets make it as Bourbon as you get, not bad but better blending could gave given more complexity.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2016, Bodegraven - dark brown coloured pour with beige head. Medium sweet malty aroma and taste, toasty, caramel, dried fruity, wooden oak nuance, some spices, cocnut light vanilla caress into the finish. Lovely.

Draught at Borefts Beer Festival 2016.
Dark brown coloured with a small off-white ehad.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel and chocolate.
Sweet and fruity flavour of caramel, dried fruits, chocolate and alcohol.
Sweet finish.
[9/23/16] Draught sample at Borefts Beer Festival 2016 in Bodegraven. Day one. Brown. Malt, caramel, some cookies. Sweet flavor with caramel, dark fruits, cookies.
Sampled at Borefts 2016, Bodegraven. Dark caramel pour with a thin tan head. Notes of dark fruit, dried fruit, dark cherries, sherry. Medium body, light carbonation and a sweet finish.

At Borefts 2016. thnx for sharing,everyone ! Pours black, OK grey head. smell is intense bourbon. taste is bourbon as well. Full body. Not bad ! but I like more depth and coplexity, this is to bourbon-forward to me.
From tap. Pours hazy brown with a small off white head. Aroma is toastedmalty and slight caramelish. Toasted malty and dense malty to caramelish. Smooth, roasted and dry and roasted malty finish.

On tap at Borefts 16. Dark brown colour, off-white head. Aroma of sweet malts, oak, caramel, vanilla, stone fruits, light woody tartness, alcohol. Flavour is also very sweet, thick malty, caramel, old cookies, coconut, vanilla, oak, fruits, light berry sourness, alcohol. Medium to full bodied. Typical BW imho.

Sample at Borefts 2016. Dark brown with a beige head. Aroma is caramel, chocolate, dates, raisins. Full bodied, sticky mouthfeel, sweet and smooth on the palate. Taste is chocolate, caramel, cream cake, dates, raisins. Fantastic.
Murky dark brown appearance. Smooth, silky and sweet. Quite a strong flavour with some notes of wood and alcohol.

On tap at Borefts, shared.
Thin off white head. Clear almost black pour. Very good.
Keg @Borefts 2016. Pours brown almost black. Nose is raisin (fruit cake). taste is woody, toffee, slight vanilla big booze. Loved it.
Draft at Borefts 2016, Day 1. Brown with a ring tan head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, malt, vanilla, oak, bourbon. Heavy sweet. Full bodied with soft carbonation. [23-09-2016]

Bottle sample @ Borefts 2016. Shared with RB Belgian crew.
Au final, une superbe conclusion à ce festival, et cela venant dune brasserie que javais un peu sous estimé au profit dautres qui mont plus que déçu par des mélanges et des idées sur papier qui dans le verre étaient plus que pénible à boire.
Bref, ce barley verse un bon brun sans col mais assez trouble et finemetn doré voire huileux au verre.
Le tout est sur des effluves de malt caramélisé presque de toffee-bonbon anglais avec un excellent côté oxydé et presque balsamique tout en gardant ample douceur mais arrivant en toute fin de bouche. Épais ponctué par un sucré résiduel qui reste marqué et un fruité noir alternant entre des figues, des dates et baies. Retrouve aussi une touche de raisins secs.

van fles @Borefts 2016, 1/2 glas blijkbaar ist prijzig spul. schenkt caramel bruin met rode gloed en licht kaki kraag. aroma van graan, rozijn, enorm zoet, donker fruit, Smaken zijn alcoholisch, granig maar dan wel erg zacht, prima fruitig, houtgerijpt, eiken, volle body, heeft wel wat weg van een Oak Aged La Trappe, uitstekende smaken. hier wil ik nog wel een flesje van.

sample at BBF, poured murky brown with a light tanned head. nose of caramel malts, toffee, dark fruits, plums, light marzipan, dried apricots, butterscotch sweetness, vanilla, and light chocolate sweetness. light cognac sweetness, sticky mouthfeel. nice barley wine

Bue en bouteille en 10cl au Borefts de De Molen à Bodegraven
Couleur noire, pas de mousse ni deffervescence
Ma grosse claque du festival
Nez suz sur la vanille et le fruit confit on a la même chose en bouche avec un chouette équilibre sur lalcool lle pruneau et les épices... Complexe sur le caramel et différents fruits à la coque.
Drank at Borefts 16 (bottle) with Tijs and Bram. Sweet beer, a bit weak body. But taste is rich. Nice.
Bottle at Borefts. Cloudy brown with a small off-white head. Big aroma of caramel, dried fruit vanilla, oak and bourbon. Sweet fruity and malty flavour with a slightly unpleasant tannic bitterness
On tap @ BBF 2016. Reddish brown with a tiny tan head. Malty and fruity tones. Malt, caramel, fruit and hops. Full body with a nice malty / fruity finish.
Impressively dark brew, for a barley wine at least. Nice, rich. But very expensive and in that regard a bit disappointing. Also got boring after the first half not morish.
Bottle at borefts. Pours deep amber, nose is caramel, toffee, wood, taste is sweet, fruity, dry finish.
From the bottle @Boreft2016, last bottles of the current batch. Lovely barley, sweet, lots of aroma & flavour (dried fruit). Great!
Keg at borefts 2016... Dark brown.. thin tan lacing.. Soft meaty chocolate malts nose.. Meaty woody toffee chocolate Roast

UPDATED: SEP 24, 2016 Sampled from bottle at Borefts 2016 day 1. Hazy brown with creme head. Sweet barley malts. Woody, dates, raisans. Big sweet. Full body, spicy carbonation. Spicy sweet toffee finish.
Bottle sampled at Borefts. Marzipan, lots of sweet malts, cognac, figs, dates, light milk chocolate, alcohol. Very sweet with alcoholic bitterness. Full bodied.
Roodbruine kleur met een goede kraag. Ruikt vol vanille, crème, zacht. Smaakt vol vanille, crème, beetje bitter. Bitterzoete afdronk.

Dark brown colored, medium- beige head. Aroma is of chocolate and caramel, toffee, dark fruits, vanilla and oak. Taste is very sweet caramel, toffee, dark fruit, some chocolate, oaky vanilla, light+ bitterness, some alcohol and warmth, quite rich. Full bodied, soft carbonation, sticky. Excellent sipper.

Thx! for sharing DutchDrebus! Sampled bottled @ Van Moll Fest 2016. Black with little head. Unusual color for the style. Nose is huge spirit, hard to pinpoint, rum, brandy, sweet, chocolate syrup, molasses, cacao, Taste is very rich on spirits, rum, brandy, bourbon & others, low molasses, syrup, sweet dark fruit syrup, pleasant alcohol with low plastic quality, bas beer seems carry quite a bit oxidation, for me it spend a tad too long on the barrels, it is still quite thick, spirit rich, yummy with some chocolate, low molasses, bit thinned out malts, Pretty good beer. Body carries some signs of oxidation.
Bottle. Dark brown color, with average creamy foam. Fine aroma: caramel, butter, wine, port, fruit, halva and Turkish lukkum. Taste: wine, caramel, brandy, very strong, butter, malty. Great beer.

Bottled. Small sample @ De Molen. Thanks John and Menno. The aroma has raisin, chocolate, brandy. Hazy, brown coloured beer with a medium sized beige head. The taste is sweet, has chocolate, dried fruit and is alcoholic. Full bodied. Nice.

Bottled. Pours deep brown nearly black with a small beige head. Aroma of apricot, cherry notes, dark fruits, wood, vanilla, alcohol, molasses and caramel. Sweet flavor that ends up being slightly more dry. Medium bodied, oily to syrupy texture and flat carbonation. A complex and very nice Barley indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Sample from shared bottle @ De Molen, thanks Menno & John. Dark brown color. Beige head. Aromas: alcohol, sweet fruit, chocolate. Retronasal theres more chocolate, with sweet fruit, alcohol a bit subdued. Flavor is moderate to full sweet, fruity. Medium to full bodied. Finishes somewhat alcoholic, fruity, light bitter.

Bottled at Sir Williams, Ljubljana.  Black with mid sized head. Huge aroma of coconut, vanilla, licorice and ouzo. Sweet with full body and solid, packed mouthfeel. Intensely flavoured; ouzo, vanilla and treacle. Warming finish. Hardcore in its flavour intensity and peppery heat. Perhaps not as complex as they describe it to be. But, at this point it is free from edges and excesses. As the thunderstorms gives way to clear sky and leaves a mild summer evening on my last night in Ljubljana, this beer is a great sipper.

Sweet fruits, caramel, raisins, port, bourbon and other booze, vanilla, oak, cocos, salmiak, light sourness (appelstroop), caramel, toffee and brown sugar, milk chocolate, super complex. Full bodied and full of flavors. Super!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAY 18, 2016 0,33 bottle blend 0615. little but nice, though coarse head, red-brownish dark. slightly creamy palate. very intensive. aroma and taste like cherries and plums in alcohol with chocolate plus some vanilla and maybe a little barique. way better than "mon cherie" ;-)

From bottle. Dark color and little foam. Intense plum aroma, like Chinese plum wine, but also chocolate and vanilla aroma. When you take a sip it tastes like mon cheri and the chocolate and vanilla gets more dominant after a few seconds. A very complex and fascinating beer!

330ml bottle at home. Pours a deep coca cola color with a medium off-white/beige head. Aroma is rich and complex, caramel, molasses, red fruits, vanilla, coconut, some licorice. Flavour is medium sweet but well balanced, complex, rounded, alcohol notes. Full body, medium to light carbonation. Interesting!

0,33 l pullo jaettu maistelussa (thanks Cuso!) Sameahko tummanruskea. Tuoksussa kookosta, makeaa mallasta, vaniljaa ja maitosuklaata, myös bourbonia. Maussa tuhtia mallasta, tummaa hedelmää, alkoholia, tuhtia suklaata.

0,33l bottle at home shared with the gf. Blend 0615. BB 06/2025. almost black color, small tan colored head. smells of wood, coconut, licorice, rather alcoholic, some nuts, marzipan. alcoholic but still very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of dried fruits, marzipan, nuts, alcohol, wood, light grapes, coconut. finishes lightly dry and alcoholic with notes of cocnut and dried fruits. very nice beer, rather on the alcoholic side, but the barrel aging is spot on, very lovely coconut notes. might benefit from some cellar aging.. (to smooth the alcohol)

Bottle shard at home. Black colour without a head, with some floating yeast. Nose is booze with some cognac. Taste is light whiskey, cognac, and grappa, decent booze. Light carbonation. Very surprising beer but in a good way!

(bottle) murky brown-black colour with a frothy light-beige head. aroma of treacle, brown sugar and cherry stones, with lots of chocolate fudge, kahlúa and apricot syrup. flavour is mostly walnuts and brown sugar, with a discreet sweetness, some spring foliage, caramel and a light ethanol numbness on the gums in the finish. heavy-bodied with soft carbonation. great!

Sehr dunkel braune Farbe, fast kein Schaum. Geruch intensiv malzig, reifes Obst, Karamell, Schokolade, Vanille, bourbon. Geschmack süß malzig, viel Vanille, Karamell, Holz, sehr vollmundig, leicht alkoholisch, schwer.
Dunkel röstig süßer, stark malziger Beginn. Dabei bleiben die Alkoholnoten im Hintergrund, weich. 10/11/11/11//11
Schöne braune ins rötliche gehende farbe! Grober nicht lange anhaltender kaum vorhandener schaum! Geschmack nach dörrobst kaffee und leichte aromen von zitrusfrüchten!

Dark brown to black colour, dissipating white head. Aroma of malts, light raisins, vanilla. Sweet flavour, caramel, dark fruits, dried fruits. Nice full body, quite boozy. Finish figs and vanilla. Blend 0615, whatever that may mean. Nice!!(from 33cL bottle shared @ Cats place. Brilliant paper packing)

33cl bottle shared with friends. Pale dark brown with a medium slightly off-white head. Full body with low carbonation. Medium sweet and bitter tones. Caramel, oak, vanilla, some booze, dark fruits and vanilla. Wow, very nice!

Hazy dark brown colour. Thin head which quickly changes into round of froth. Roasted coffee, liqeur, vanilla, caramel, berries in the aroma. Vanilla, hints of cognac, caramel in the first taste. Dark fruits and bread in the middle. Some oaky and liquery notes in the aftertaste. Silky, well balanced, complex, heavy bodied, medium carbonated, really interesting and enjoyable drink.

Bottle from Saeglopur (euro local swap 4/2015), many many thanks! Pours dark brown with a thin beige head. Aroma: bourbon, wood, vanilla, bit of port. Taste follows with figs, red berries, cocoa, raisins, cocos, and more pronounced port notes. Sweet, medium bitter, slick, almost sticky texture, full body, average carbonation. Lingering sweet bourbon and berry finish. Happy new year!

Had some problems with opening of this bottle, but it was worth it. 
Amazing aromas, beutyfull colour, in mouth maybe a bit too much vanilla taste, but except that it was really nice. cant wait for the next one :D

Bottle, 0.33l. Pours murky dark brown color with thin totally diminishing light brown head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma of coconut, vanilla, caramel, wood, berries and sherry. Taste starts with sweet roasted malt, vanilla and alcohol, follows by chocolate and dried fruits acidity, coconut still present, mouthfeel is warming and spicy, while finish is almost without any bitterness. Full body, thick texture and average carbonation in palate. Super strong and complex winter warmer...

330ml bottle (300e of overpriced beer tasting) - thanks Elvira! 12.3% - nice. Coconut, overly sweet and sugary, and not malty enough for what it is. Watery and alcohol overpowers everything at the end. Probably will get better with age.

Pitch black, small tan head. Aroma of alcohol, oak barrel, coconut and caramel. Taste starts with some brown sugar, than it continues with extreme coconut and ends with brutal coffee and cocoa, with thin line of alcohol in the background the whole time. Thick and creamy, full bodies, soft carbonated oil. Just epic. //Thanks to Maki for this one, it was a lovely gift.

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared by Joes. A bit unclear dark brown color, small off-white head. Aroma is malts, superb vanilla and barrel aging going on in there. Taste malts, caramel, vanilla, bourbon. Medium to full body, medium carbonation. Very nice, lovely barley wine.

Bottle: Taster:
Some off white bubbles on top of cloudy brown ruby colored beer.
Aroma of butter, butter scotch, bourbon, vanilla, herbal, 
Flavour is vanilla, fudge, some caramel, creamy, some bitters, thick, lot of sweet candy tones...
Aftertaste is is butter scotch, bitter, vanilla...
Low carbo, silky mouthfeel, full bodied.
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle @ joes. Red brown colour with no head. Smells boozy, wood, oak, whisky, sweet, vanilla. Tastes sweet, vanilla, oak, wood, wow. I love me some vanilla. Full body, soft carbo.
Donler oranje bruin bier met een goede witte schuim kraag. Ruikt overrijp fruit, vanille, heerlijk. Smaakt alcohol, vanille, rode fruit.

Bottle, with a rope and wax that was extremely hard to open. Strong aroma of booze, bourbon and port-like red fruit. Taste is filthy rich, with lots of thick bourbon vanilla, ripe fruit, caramel and some brandy-ish fruit kick. Really long evolving finish. Very nice, great surprise.

Pours a pitch black color, topped with a small beige head that immediately goes away completely. Very complex aroma starting with caramel and dark chocolate, later vanilla taking over control. Some woody presence and whicky notes are also pretty easy to pick up. Taste starts fairly sweet and vailla like, chocolate playing the supporting role in teh back. Alcohol, whisky like is easily felt, but still 12% are nicely tucked away. A bit roastiness in teh aftertaste concludes this experience. Very smooth and silky, creamy body. For special occasions.

Shared bottle. Pours is dark with thick beige head that last for only few seconds. Aroma of yeast, dried fruits, pastry, licquorice, cocoa, brandy. Taste is medium sweet, light bitter, fruity mouthfeel. Heavy body, heavy oily texture, alcohol warmth. Great.

Bottled - Hazy dark brown colour, medium, persistent tan head with lacing. Aroma of almost everything. Coffee, coconut, raisins, dried plum, caramel, red berries, vanilla. Taste is the same, very sweet, low hop bitterness. Full body, oily texture, low carbonation, a bit boozy finish. A very comlex beer, a great experience, must try.

Bottle @ gambrinus, tartu. Pours brown with minimum brownis head. Aroma is strong, toffee, caramel, dried plums, chocolate, raisins, vanilla. Taste is medium sweet, chocolate, vanilla, red wine (merlot or something) sourness, hints of brandy, Well hidden ABV.

330ml bottle (thanks Elvira). Murky dark brown color. Tiny to almost no head. Horribly sweet, raisins, liquorice, bourbon in aroma. Raisins, sweet, bit woody, caramel, alcohol in taste. Raisins in aftertaste. Mild fizzy carbonation. Nice brew.

330ml bottle (300e of overpriced beer tasting) - thanks ElviraS!
Woh - alcohol is the first thing you notice in the aroma. Plenty of bourbon. Very rich malts, but the alcohol is fiery - in particular in the finish. Palate is heavy with the malts, theres no uplifting aspects at all. Its not exactly sticky, but certainly a bit oppressive.

(Bottle, 0.33 - blend 0615, at Koht, 20150926) The beer poured nearly black. Its head was small and lightly brown. Aroma had vanilla, sweetness, dark fruits and malts. Palate was medium bodied with a lot of alcohol burning with low carbonation. Flavours were sweetness, vanilla, booze, wood and bitterness. Aftertaste was burning and bitter. A sweet boozy mess.
Bottle. Pours dark brown with brownish head. The head doesnt stay. Aroma is sweet, malt, bourbon, cognac, alcohol. Flavor is sweet, caramel, fruits, bitterness, alcohol, sourness. Overall: good.

Blend Dark brown beer, almost no head. Nose is bourbon, booze, caramel, roasty notes, sweetness. Flavor is roast and sharp booze, fairly pleasant caramel and dried fruit, but god damn the booze is sharp. Finishes with more booze. The booze steamrolls everything.

Bottle batch 6/15. Deep dark brown color. Malt, toffee, vanilla, bourbon and oak Dominating the aroma. Almost full bodied. Alcoholic. Toffee, red fruit, soft vinous notes, bourbon and vanilla in the flavor. Flavorful, aromatic and quite alcoholic but also Fairly complex. Good!

At Villagio Della Birra 2015.Clear dark brown color, teal head. Sweet, alcohol, cocoa scent. Alcohol, sweet taste. Raisin, sweet, alcohol aftertaste. Medium to smooth mouthfeel, medium low bitterness.

Bottle kindly shared by Gurthnar, many thanks. Very dark brown color with with medium white head. Sweet aroma with caramel, roasted malt, honey. Very sweet taste with nuts, caramel, roasted malt, alcohol. Very tasty.

Bottle from Drinkshop. Aroma lots of dried fruits, my favourite coconut, caramel, strength coming through. Lightly hazy dark brown colour. Taste is very smooth and complex, lots going on. Rich maltiness with caramel, chocolate, light roasted, strong dried fruits. Sherry. Surprisingly well attenuated, moderate body. Warming but not boozy at all. Delicious.

Bottle shared by Gurthnar, many, many thanks for this one. Pours dark brown color, beige head. Aroma of vanilla, coconut, milk chocolate, bourbon, caramel. Taste is sweet, vanilla, bourbon, coconut, milk chocolate, caramel, coffee, hints of licqourice, boozy, very nice.
dark brown colour, moderate sized beige head; aroma of herbal liqueur, dried fruits, some woody and vanilla notes, carameland alcohol; taste is the same - not bad at all!

0.33 bottle from Ljubljana. Shared with Igor and lovely Anja. Dark, almost black, almost no head. Strong cherry barrel aroma, wood, spices, red fruits, alcohol, glue. Nuts, fruits, candy, alcohol bite in the finish, heavy on the barrel. Sweet. Dry. Full body, oily structure. Great!
Soo great limited edition series beer from Bevog. Taste is caramel, chocolate, dried fruits some alcohol some wood also some spirits.

330 ml waxed bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Black body, with a small, creamy, coffee colored head.
Rich, complex aroma of sherry, bourbon, oak, coconut, vanilla, chocolate, caramel, dark and dried fruits, subtle coffee, alcohol.
Tastes of bourbon, oak, coconut, vanilla, cocoa, chocolate, coffee, dark fruits, some sherry, some liquorice, booze.
Full, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes warm, boozy, a bit astringent, quite dry, roasty, with oak, cocoa, some coffee, subtle hops.

Very tasty! Complex, dense and quite boozy, but drinks 
smooth, alcohol isnt as dominant as the ABV suggests. Great balance between various barrel notes and dark roasty, but also sweet notes. Clearly the best Barley Wine from Austria so far for me, on par with American examples and a new highlight by Bevog.

Bottled 330ml. -from Pivoteka Zagreb, shared with Marko. Almost black coloured, medium sized beige head, alcohol and dried fruits in the nose. Sweet malty, dried fruits, caramel, notes of wood and port wine with noticable alcohol in the finish. Good brew but still not really worth of 12.50 we paid for it. Also not suitable for hot summer days.

Bottle. Dark brown body with brown very fast disappearing head. Very nice aroma of roasted malts some dried red fruits some caramel some vanilla and hints of wood. Taste is caramel, chocolate, dried fruits some alcohol some wood also some spirits. Aftertaste is dry wood some bitterness and also some malty sweetness. Very nice one but I think its a little bit to hot at the moment for this.

Barleywine Paperbag Series. Hagger Blend 0615 from Pivoteka Zagreb, shared with ogivlado. Daaaaark brown, almost black, off white head, went away relatively fast. Dry, full sweet maltiness, sticky, dark fruits, plum jam, light alcohol, vague soy sauce, slightly dusty. Quite nice really. Strong raisins in the taste, but not overbearing, silky mouthfeel, surrounded by a well integrated mild saltiness, sorta reminiscent of salmiakki, though, of course, far more balanced, caramelly. Vague alcohol flavor, but the warming effect is quite strong, making the decision to release it in the middle of summer baffling. Quite light, easy-going taste for the ABV all in all making it very, very drinkable for the strength. Pretty great all in all.
